summary: Multiple OpenTelemetry instrumentation bugs affecting span timing accuracy, service name propagation, trace hierarchy, and internal SDK traces visibility in the TypeScript SDK.
userImpact: Users setting up OpenTelemetry tracing encounter incorrect span timings, missing service names in traces, unfiltered SDK-internal spans, and broken parent-child relationships in child workflows.
rootCause: OTEL resource not being passed to makeWorkflowExporter; span hierarchy not properly maintained for child workflows; internal traces not filtered by default
proposedFix: Make OTEL resource required in makeWorkflowExporter; implement proper span parent-child linking for child workflows; add filtering for SDK-internal traces; ensure ContinueAsNew is traced
resolutionDetails: Issues were resolved locally by the maintainer and included in a PR addressing service name propagation, span hierarchy, and trace filtering
keyQuote: Child workflows are not connected to root workflows (i.e. the child workflow span `workflow.execute` should be a child span of the root `workflow.schedule`)
